title: Sixth stabbing in Liverpool in nine days after man attacked near Subway
text:
The latest attack saw a man in his 20s knifed repeatedly outside a Subway (Picture: Liverpool Echo)

Six people have been stabbed across Merseyside in the space of just nine days.

In the latest attack a man believed to be in his 20s was repeatedly knifed outside a Subway in West Derby on October 24.

A 26-year-old man and 16-year-old boy were stabbed in separate attacks in Kensington and West Derby two days earlier.

Another man in his 20s was stabbed in the neck after being attacked in broad daylight in Wallasey on October 21 and a 41-year-old woman was held on suspicion of the attempted murder of a man knifed on an estate in Netherley three days earlier on October 18.

Witnesses described hearing a male shouting ‘we’ve got him, we’ve stabbed him in the head’ after a 17-year-old was knifed in the back and chest in Toxteth on Tuesday, October 15.

Brave Subway staff reportedly tried to help the injured man (Picture: Liverpool Echo)

Emergency services were called to the scene at 4.30pm on Thursday (Picture: Liverpool Echo)

Police were called to the junction of Blackmoor Drive and East Prescot Road at 4.30pm on Thursday following reports a man had been stabbed multiple times to his chest and leg by Subway.

Restaurant workers and passers-by helped look after him until the emergency services arrived.

One woman told the Liverpool Echo: ‘That’s the middle of the day, it’s disgusting that they care so little.

‘There could have been kids passing or anything and I’m sure the staff are traumatised. Absolutely pathetic and it’s getting worse.’

The man was rushed to hospital with serious injuries.

A 26-year-old man was stabbed in the arm and legs on Upper Baker Street in Kensington at around 8.15pm on October 22.

Fortunately his injuries are not thought to be life-threatening.

Less than two hours later a 16-year-old boy was knifed several times on a grassy area close to Three Butts Lane in West Derby by a group of four males who fled on bikes.

He managed to get himself to hospital where he was said to be in a stable condition.

A teenager and 20-year-old man were arrested after a male in his 20s was stabbed in the neck in broad daylight in Wallasey at around 1.30pm on October 21.

The victim was airlifted to hospital for treatment to non-life-threatening injuries.

One witness who was in Costcutter told the Echo: ‘I was just doing my shopping and the guy at the till had just scanned everything when this guy ran in screaming and saying “my mate’s been stabbed, my mate’s been stabbed”.

She added: ‘He had blood coming out of his neck and it was pouring down his arms. And he was shouting “I’m dying, I’m dying”.’

A 26-year-old man was stabbed in the arm and legs on Upper Baker Street in Kensington on October 22 (Picture: Liverpool Echo)

An air ambulance was deployed to an estate on Scafell Walk at around 2.30pm on October 18 following reports a man in his 40s suffered serious stab wounds.

Police arrested a 41-year-old woman close by on suspicion of attempted murder.

The first attack took place in Boswell Street at around 8pm last Tuesday, October 15.

A 17-year-old boy was knifed in the back and chest during a street fight.

Detective Inspector Paul Nilsens said officers have ‘devoted significant resources and targeted operations across Merseyside aimed at ridding our streets of knife crime’.

‘We will never stand by and allow people to carry knives and bring the risk of serious harm not just to other people, but also to themselves,’ he added.

Anyone with information regarding the latest attack is asked to contact Merseyside Police social media desk via Twitter @MerPolCC or Facebook Merseyside Police CC.

description: Six people were stabbed across Merseyside in the space of just nine days.
